meanings.definition: To sell more of (something) than can be supplied.
meanings.sent1: The store tried to oversell the popular toy, but they ran out quickly.
meanings.sent2: The company had to apologize for overselling concert tickets and not having enough for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The salesman's attempt to oversell the limited edition sneakers backfired when customers realized they were fake.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the product led her to oversell its benefits, leaving her friends skeptical.
meanings.sent5: The vendor's attempt to oversell the fresh produce resulted in a lot of wasted food.

meanings.definition: To present or describe (something) in a way that makes it seem better or more important than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent tried to oversell the small apartment as a luxurious penthouse.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team knew they had to oversell the new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to oversell his achievements made his friends roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was full of overselling promises that seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent5: The travel brochure oversold the resort, leaving the tourists disappointed upon arrival.
